intro: Goeppertia cleistantha, commonly known as the silver stripe calathea, is a species of flowering plant in the Marantaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, mottled leaves with silver and green patterns, which are often variegated. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Goeppertia cleistantha is popular as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
